arts.ttl: 'It wasn't a game I liked to see': Reading boss on comfortable defeat to Blackpool
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt was not impressed with a lot of what he saw as Blackpool inflicted his first defeat as permanent manager, winning 3-0 at the SCL Stadium. Goals from Albie Morgan, Rob Apter and Ashley Fletcher signalled a first home defeat since September and a first defeat under playing legend Hunt, who drew 1-1 at Wycombe Wanderers last week. The Royals were second best throughout, although they certainly did not get the rub of the green with officials. Speaking after the defeat, Hunt said: " We go back and can analyse it all we want but ultimately, we weren’t good enough. I felt there were moments in the game- we had a really good chance before their goal. If you look at their goal, the lad is offside from the goal kick and its not given. We don’t win the ball off the knockdown and they get a shot from distance which goes in. on the day, we were a little bit slow and took too many touches at times, but they’re a young group.

arts.ttl: Blackpool claim convincing win at play-off hopefuls Reading
Noel Hunt still searching for Reading win as Blackpool ease to comfortable victory
arts.sum: Noel Hunt is still searching for his first win as Reading manager across both interim and permanent spells as Blackpool marched to a 3-0 win at the Select Car Leasing Stadium. Second best across the pitch, veteran boss Steve Bruce saw his energetic, efficient and physical Tangerines sidewalk away with a third successive win courtesy of goals from Albie Morgan, Rob Apter and Ashley Fletcher. The Royals were looking for a ninth successive home victory, form which had propelled them up the table, but never looked like troubling the Lancashire outfit. The final home match before Christmas, plenty were in early to welcome Nigel Gibbs, Mikele Leigertwood and Hunt into the home dugout following Ruben Selles’ departure to Hull City.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Noel Hunt makes one change from Wycombe draw for Blackpool tie
arts.sum: Reading manager Noel Hunt made one change side from last week's 1-1 draw with Wycombe Wanderers for this afternoon's clash with Blackpool, with Andre Garcia replacing Jeriel Dorsett. Taking charge at the SCL Stadium for the first time since being appointed permanent manager, Hunt confirmed his backroom staff of Mikele Leigertwood and Nigel Gibbs last night. Making nine changes in midweek and exiting the EFL Trophy at Walsall, normal order has been resumed with a full-strength side. Joel Pereira returns between the sticks after David Button's red card in the West Midlands, with Michael Craig; Amadou Mbengue; Tyler Bindon and 17-year-old Garcia making up the back line.

arts.ttl: Title-winning coach returns for third Reading spell as assistant to Noel Hunt
arts.sum: Reading have confirmed Noel Hunt's coaching staff, with Championship winner Nigel Gibbs returning to the club. Hunt signed a two-and-a-half year deal following the departure of Ruben Selles and is preparing for his first home match in charge tomorrow as Blackpool visit Berkshire. Due to the quick turnaround, and the fact Selles took coaches James Oliver-Pearce and Tobias Loveland to Hull City with him, the former striker had the opportunity to bring in fresh faces. Former teammate and Under-18s chief Mikele Leigertwood, who famously scored the goal to take the club into the Premier League in 2012, has permanently joined Hunt's first-team coaching staff.

arts.ttl: Where are they now? Last Reading side to play at home under Hunt ahead of Blackpool
arts.sum: Hit with a points deduction in April 2022 which plunged Reading into the relegation zone, Paul Ince was sacked with five matches to go and the role of interim boss was given to club legend and Under-21 chief, Noel Hunt. Drawing three and losing two, the Royals were relegated to League One with one match to spare and after a summer of discontent, Ruben Selles was given the role on a full-time basis. Fast-forward 18 months and with Reading sat in sixth, still battling crisis everywhere you turn, Selles has departed to join Hull City and the focus turns back to Hunt, who now is the permanent boss on a two-and-a-half year deal.

arts.ttl: Fan Gallery: Nearly 250 Reading fans make Walsall trip for EFL Trophy clash
arts.sum: Nearly 250 Reading fans made the midweek trip to Walsall in Tuesday night's EFL Trophy defeat to Walsall. Despite falling to nine-men, the Royals took an unlikely lead through Tyler Sackey, one which they held until the final kick of the game when the Saddlers drew level. The League Two leaders won on spot-kicks and the Royals departed the Bescot Poundland Stadium with defeat. Take a look below at our fan gallery, with pictures courtesy of JasonPIX.

arts.ttl: Preview: Reading vs. Blackpool - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Reading and Blackpool, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Reading set for largest crowd of the season against Blackpool for Hunt's first match
arts.sum: Reading are set for the largest home crowd of the season on Saturday as Blackpool visit the Select Car Leasing Stadium for Noel Hunt's first home match in charge. The 2011/12 Championship winner played over 160 times for the club between 2008 and 2013. Returning to the club off the pitch, the former Republic of Ireland international lead the Under-21s to a play-off finish in the PL2, a Berks and Bucks title and qualification for the Premier League International Cup. With Reading sitting sixth in League One, Ruben Selles departed to join Hull City and Hunt was appointed on a two-and-a-half year deal.

arts.ttl: Late Watford equaliser denies Ruben Selles perfect start to life at Hull City
arts.sum: Former Reading boss Ruben Selles was denied a perfect start to life as Hull City manager as Watford scored a dramatic 88th-minute equaliser to hold the Tigers to a 1-1 draw. Selles officially departed Berkshire on Friday and was in the stands to watch their 1-0 defeat to Blackburn Rovers on Saturday, while Noel Hunt was appointed his replacement and drew 1-1 with League One leaders Wycombe Wanderers. Dropping to the bottom of the Championship, Selles and his coaching staff- which consisted of James Oliver-Pearce and Tobias Loveland- took charge for the first time on Wednesday against play-off chasing Watford. Chris Bedia opened the scoring in the final 10 minutes as Selles looked to have picked up a first win within a week of arriving, however Rocco Vata levelled the scores with two minutes remaining to ensure the points were shared.
